address: Xã Buôn Choah, Huyện Krông Nô, Tỉnh Đắk Nông
thought:
**Analyzing the Address and Relevant Resolutions**

Okay, so I'm looking at the old address: "Xã Buôn Choah, Huyện Krông Nô, Tỉnh Đắk Nông". I need to figure out the new administrative unit(s) based on the resolutions and new ward data.

First, I broke down the old address: "Xã Buôn Choah" (ward), "Huyện Krông Nô" (district), and "Tỉnh Đắk Nông" (province).

Then, I immediately checked the province resolutions. I spotted Resolution 60-NQ/TW, which clarifies that Đắk Nông has merged into Lâm Đồng. So, the province has changed to Tỉnh Lâm Đồng.

Next, I looked at other resolutions. 1660/NQ-UBTVQH15, concerning Đắk Lắk, was initially confusing because it mentioned "Krông Nô" but not "Buôn Choah," and it refers to Đắk Lắk. Then, I found the critical resolution: 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15 concerning Lâm Đồng.

This resolution explicitly states that "Xã Buôn Choah" is part of a merger to create "Xã Nam Đà". That is a direct hit! I also see that this resolution is applicable in the context of the province being "Tỉnh Lâm Đồng".

Finally, I cross-referenced this with the new ward data. I found a match for "Xã Nam Đà" within the "Tỉnh Lâm Đồng".

It's clear that "Xã Buôn Choah" is now part of "Xã Nam Đà" in the province of "Tỉnh Lâm Đồng." I had to eliminate the confusion of the district name being the same, but the ward name being different and in a different merger.

citation.header: 1671/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lâm Đồng
citation.line: 84. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Buôn Choáh, Đắk Sôr và Nam Đà thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Nam Đà.
